subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments and diagnosis.
Lophopedia apicalis
,
L. minor
sp. nov.
, and
L. paraensis
sp.nov.
compose a group of species with very similar morphology. Small bees (ca. 7.0 mm in length), integument mostly dark brown, wing membrane pale brown to pale yellow infumated, mesepisternum mostly smooth (sparse coarse punctures), clypeus of female usually with two small yellow spots on margin laterally. These species can be distinguished mainly by the males, due to the pattern of pubescence on margins of terga, shape and pubescence of S 7 .
